title: Scientific Computing Specialist
body:
Designing, deploying and running of our HPC cluster

 Expert support for users running their jobs on our HPC cluster

 Monitoring systems, networks and security of the HPC environment

 Stay up to date with international and national developments in the HPC

community

 Providing end user documentation and training

 Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related

technical discipline

 Proven experience with Linux system administration and IT automation

(Ansible)

 Experience with large parallel file-systems (BeeGFS) and file-systems in

general (NFS, ZFS)

 Familiarity with scientific tools and programming languages like Python,

Matlab, C, C++

 Hands on experience with job scheduling and resource management tools

(SLURM, …)

 Some experience with HPC network architecture such as InfiniBand

 Experience with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA and similar libraries is a plus

 Good communication skills and good command of the English language

IST Austria

We offer a minimum salary of EUR 50,000 gross/year (40h/week), with possible overpayment depending on education,

qualification and work experience. IST Austria processes your personal data in accordance with the statutory data protection

regulations. For more information including your rights as a data subject please refer to our data privacy statement

https//ist.ac.at/data-protection/.

Requirements

 Offers challenging positions in a

dynamic and growing organization

 Supports learning and development

 Provides flexible working times

and numerous fringe benefits

 Promotes an international and

open culture

 Supports an appreciative and

respectful work environment

 Values diversity and is committed to

equality

 Free Shuttlebus for employees

(Departing from Heiligenstadt,

travel time about 22 min.) and free

parking places

To apply for this position send

your application (including CV,

certificates and references)

by e-mail to

recruiting@ist.ac.at
